dir-section.heading: The Environment
dir-section.p: In April 2018 the European Court of Justice ruled that Poland had carried out illegal logging in the huge Białowieża Forest, a UNESCO-protected World Heritage site including areas of primeval forest and covering some 141,885 hectares, which is located on the Poland-Belarus border. At least 10,000 trees were believed to have been cut down after the Government increased logging limits threefold in 2016, in breach of European Union (EU) law. The Białowieża Forest is the habitat for several species of animal, including wolves, lynx and some 25% of the vulnerable European bison population worldwide. In December 2018 Poland hosted a UN Climate Change Conference (Conference of the Parties—COP 24) for the third time; the event took place in Katowice, an industrial city associated with coal mining and identified as having significant experience in alleviating the adverse effects of environmental damage. In December 2019 Poland was the only EU member state to refuse to adopt a target for `net zero’ carbon emissions by 2050 as part of the EU’s plans for addressing climate change.

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Institute for Agricultural and Forest Environmental Studies

org-entry.content-note: research and consultancy in environmental management systems
research centre into major environmental issues
research into natural biological processes, preservation of biodiversity and rare and threatened plant and animal species
research into the degradation of natural resources, changing ecosystems, water resources and landscape

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Institute of Urban and Regional Development

org-entry.content-note: research on physical planning, municipal economy and architecture

address.verbatim-address: 05-090 Raszyn, Sekocin Stary, ul. Braci Lesnej 3

org-entry.content-note: part-funded by the Ministry of Climate and Environment

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Coalition to Protect the Polish Countryside

org-entry.content-note: major independent asscn, affiliated to Friends of the Earth Int.
promotes sustainable development, human ecology, environmental education, waste recycling, conservation strategies

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Polish Society for the Protection of Birds

org-entry.found-date: 1992 as a Programme Office of the German Marshall Fund of the USA
org-entry.content-note: changed name and registered as not-for-profit foundation in 1997
provides support for NGOs, small business and local communities in establishing and managing environmental partnerships for sustainable development
